title.native: とある科学の超電磁砲S

description:
The second season of Toaru Kagaku no Railgun.

Something sinister is going on in Academy City. The shadows are filled with whispers of an organization cloning super-powered students known as espers. High-ranking master of electricity, Mikoto Misaka, laughs off these stories until she comes face to face with a copy of herself. After learning that these clones - her sisters - are being systematically murdered in a series of experiments designed to turn a sadistic killer into the strongest esper in history, Misaka vows to save her copies and destroy the organization responsible for the project.

As Misaka prepares to face off against the organization’s power-hungry esper, she discovers that she wasn’t the only victim of the scientific forces conspiring within the city - and that’s something Misaka and the girls of Judgement simply won’t stand for.

(Source: Funimation)
synonyms: เรลกัน แฟ้มลับคดีวิทยาศาสตร์ ภาค 2
เรลกัน แฟ้มลับคดีวิทยาศาสตร์ ภาคที่ 2
Cấm thư ma thuật Index ngoại truyện: Siêu Railgun khoa học Phần 2

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Medicine
tags.description: Centered around the activities of people working in the field of medicine.

tags.name: Boarding School
tags.description: Features characters attending a boarding school.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Clone
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an artificial exact copy of another organism.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

node.description:
[Official website](http://dengekibunko.jp/author/kamachikazuma/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kamachi_ka)

Kazuma Kamachi is a Japanese light novel author and the original creator of the Toaru Majutsu no Index light novel series and its spin-off manga series, Toaru Kagaku no Railgun and Toaru Kagaku no Accelerator.

As he uses a pen name, his real name and identity is as of yet unknown.

Before becoming the famous writer of the Index light novel series, Kamachi wrote a story entitled Schrödinger's City (シュレディンガーの街 Shuredingā no Machi?) as an entry in the  9th Dengeki Game Novel Prize; unfortunately, his submission failed to reach past the third selection stage of the said competition. However, his story caught the attention of the editor-in-chief of Dengeki, and Kamachi later became in-charge in writing the book Kaite-minai ka? (書いてみないか？? lit., Want to Try Writing?), which became his debut as a professional writer.

Kamachi began writing novels while he was still studying as a junior high school student. However, his works were not finished until he graduated from high school.
[Website](http://r-s.sakura.ne.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/haimurakiyotaka) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=164728) | [Pawoo](https://pawoo.net/@2075642)

Sachika's voice acting career began after winning the "KADOKAWA×UP-FRONT STYLE Idol Seiyuu Audition 2008" competition in February 2009. She debuted by voicing Yuri Gamagori in the anime Shangri-La.

Sachika's hobbies includes choral singing, watching comedy shows, poetry, and playing electric guitar. She is also very good friends with [Sumire Uesaka](https://anilist.co/staff/109441/Sumire-Uesaka) (whom she has called "my waifu") and [Ayaka Ohashi](https://anilist.co/staff/110903/Ayaka-Ohashi), two fellow seiyuu in the Bang Dream franchise. Sachika's favorite anime are Mobile Suit Gundam 00 and The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya, and she admires both [Maaya Sakamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95090/Maaya-Sakamoto) and [Yukari Tamura](https://anilist.co/staff/95027/Yukari-Tamura).

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia, edited)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

He made his full directorial debut with the release of [Honey and Clover II](https://anilist.co/anime/1142/Hachimitsu-to-Clover-II/) in 2006, after which he directed [Idolmaster: Xenoglossia](https://anilist.co/anime/1694/Idolmster-Xenoglossia/) in 2007, and [Toradora!](https://anilist.co/anime/4224/Toradora/) in 2008. He has also directed the spin-off series of [Toaru Majutsu no Index](https://anilist.co/anime/4654/Toaru-Majutsu-no-Index/), respectively named [Toaru Kagaku no Railgun](https://anilist.co/anime/6213/Toaru-Kagaku-no-Railgun/), which released in 2009.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [mangaka](https://anilist.co/staff/245226/Yuuichi-Tanaka)._
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/水上清資)

fripSide is a Japanese indie pop band. Started in 2002. They also have many other support members.  

On March 15, 2009, nao stated on the fripSide Official Website that she had graduated from fripSide. Sat and nao want to pursue different musical careers, as nao intends to pursue a solo singing career. Meanwhile Sat will continue in fripSide with a new project called, fripside: THE NEXT PROJECT. Seiyuu Yoshino Nanjo took over as the vocalist of fripSide with her debut single "only my railgun", the opening of the anime, To Aru Kagaku no Railgun. 

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Members__
- sat - [Satoshi Yaginuma](https://anilist.co/staff/111757) (八木沼悟志) - (lyrics, synthesizers, composer, arrangement) (2002-present)
- Mao Uesugi (上杉真央) - (vocals) (2022-present)
- Hisayo Abe (阿部寿世) - (vocals) (2022-present)

__Former Members__
- [nao](https://anilist.co/staff/118365/nao) (vocal, lyrics) (2002-2009)
- [Yoshino Nanjo](https://anilist.co/staff/96592/Yoshino-Nanjo) (南條愛乃) - (vocals, lyrics) (2009-2022)

Well-known members: KOTOKO (Shakugan no Shana, Hayate no Gotoku, Kannaduki no Miko) Mami Kawada (Shakugan no Shana, To Aru Majutsu no Index) Lia (AIR, Angel Beats, Clannad)  Eiko Shimamiya (Higurashi no Naku Koro ni) Mell (Black Lagoon, Rideback, Highschool Of The Dead)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/watanabesho)__ | __[Blog (jp)](https://ameblo.jp/shoooou/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Smile Company)](https://www.smile-co.jp/archives/creator/431)__

Shou Watanabe is a Japanese keyboardist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of three-piece rock band [Sajou no Hana](https://anilist.co/staff/137163/).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/watanabesho)__ | __[Blog (jp)](https://ameblo.jp/shoooou/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Smile Company)](https://www.smile-co.jp/archives/creator/431)__

Shou Watanabe is a Japanese keyboardist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of three-piece rock band [Sajou no Hana](https://anilist.co/staff/137163/).
